Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


As Business Intelligence Analyst Data Enablement, you play a pivotal role in driving business growth by unlocking the value of data in Zalando Lounge & Outlets.

As part of the central Data Platform Team and core team of Analytics experts, you will develop and improve the data landscape, data governance and reporting landscape for the second largest part of Zalando business . You will collaborate with diverse teams across Zalando (business, technical, data) to enable the use of our foundational data and analytics competencies, shaping the future of data usage to drive analysis, insights generation and decision making. Your responsibilities will also include supporting and enhancing the integration of our planning tooling (ANAPLAN), ensuring its seamless operation as part of our overall planning and reporting landscape. This involves stewarding data inputs and outputs, enabling strategic modules, and integrating ANAPLAN data with other tools like Tableau.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


Business & Data



You identify data requirements and translate into functional requirements for data engineers, following best practices and developing new data products, acting as the data steward for core data domains
Support the design, data modeling, maintenance, and stewardship of key data layers and metrics, including those used in planning and reporting tools such as ANAPLAN (planning tool) and Tableau (BI tool).
Support data quality initiatives, ensuring that datasets meet governance standards and that documentation is up-to-date.



Reporting



Assist in curating data sources and ensuring seamless integration into reporting and planning tools like Tableau and ANAPLAN.



Data Enablement & Governance



Educate end users and data professionals on key data topics, including new datasets, data modeling best practices, reporting principles, and the broader data landscape.
Act as a champion for scalable and efficient data practices, balancing business needs with long-term platform sustainability.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




A degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, Data Analytics or similar areas
Proven track record of >3 years experience in Business Intelligence or Business Analytics in an enterprise environment
Good understanding of data warehousing and analytical methods (e.g. databases and data structures, descriptive and diagnostic data analysis)
Solid knowledge of SQL and data modeling. Hands-on experience with Tableau > 1 year
Excellent root cause analysis and data related problem-solving skills are your strengths. You are a driver for change and enthusiastic about data, people and processes
Good project management and stakeholder management skills
Exposure to financial planning workflows and data integration is a strong plus.



If you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!


OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando, discounts from external partners
Two paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching are available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

About Lounge By Zalando

Lounge by Zalando is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 17 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Lounge by Zalando is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell it.

https //www.zalando-lounge.de


Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.
Show more
HTML:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


As Business Intelligence Analyst Data Enablement, you play a pivotal role in driving business growth by unlocking the value of data in Zalando Lounge & Outlets.

As part of the central Data Platform Team and core team of Analytics experts, you will develop and improve the data landscape, data governance and reporting landscape for the second largest part of Zalando business . You will collaborate with diverse teams across Zalando (business, technical, data) to enable the use of our foundational data and analytics competencies, shaping the future of data usage to drive analysis, insights generation and decision making. Your responsibilities will also include supporting and enhancing the integration of our planning tooling (ANAPLAN), ensuring its seamless operation as part of our overall planning and reporting landscape. This involves stewarding data inputs and outputs, enabling strategic modules, and integrating ANAPLAN data with other tools like Tableau.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


Business & Data


  • You identify data requirements and translate into functional requirements for data engineers, following best practices and developing new data products, acting as the data steward for core data domains
  • Support the design, data modeling, maintenance, and stewardship of key data layers and metrics, including those used in planning and reporting tools such as ANAPLAN (planning tool) and Tableau (BI tool).
  • Support data quality initiatives, ensuring that datasets meet governance standards and that documentation is up-to-date.


Reporting


  • Assist in curating data sources and ensuring seamless integration into reporting and planning tools like Tableau and ANAPLAN.


Data Enablement & Governance


  • Educate end users and data professionals on key data topics, including new datasets, data modeling best practices, reporting principles, and the broader data landscape.
  • Act as a champion for scalable and efficient data practices, balancing business needs with long-term platform sustainability.



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



  • A degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, Data Analytics or similar areas
  • Proven track record of >3 years experience in Business Intelligence or Business Analytics in an enterprise environment
  • Good understanding of data warehousing and analytical methods (e.g. databases and data structures, descriptive and diagnostic data analysis)
  • Solid knowledge of SQL and data modeling. Hands-on experience with Tableau > 1 year
  • Excellent root cause analysis and data related problem-solving skills are your strengths. You are a driver for change and enthusiastic about data, people and processes
  • Good project management and stakeholder management skills
  • Exposure to financial planning workflows and data integration is a strong plus.


If you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!


OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


  • Employee shares program
  • 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando, discounts from external partners
  • Two paid volunteering days a year
  • Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
  • Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
  • 27 days of vacation a year to start
  • Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
  • Family services, including counseling and support
  • Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
  • Mental health support and coaching are available
  • Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review


Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

About Lounge By Zalando

Lounge by Zalando is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 17 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Lounge by Zalando is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell it.

Title: Data & Analytics Consulting - Analyst (m/d/f)
Description:
Who We Are




Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do




As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company




Why Join Us?




Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?




Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus




How to Apply?




To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.




What to expect during the interviews process?




At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html




Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.




Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als “Data Analyst” (m/w/d)




Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.




Was wir bieten:

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt.




Dein Impact:

Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Data Analyst Valuation (m/w/d)
Description:
GEMEINSAM ERFOLGREICH

Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung? Sie möchten Ihre Karriere in eine neue Richtung lenken? Sie möchten etwas bewegen?

Unser Data Intelligence & Digital Enablement Team in Deutschland schafft durch den Einsatz von Daten, Technologien und innovativen Lösungen echten Mehrwert für unser Business. Wir treiben die digitale Transformation des Unternehmens voran, managen zentrale Enterprise Applikationen und unterstützen unsere operativen Business- und Research-Teams bei der Erweiterung, Pflege, Konsolidierung, Analyse und Visualisierung einer einzigartigen Immobiliendatenlandschaft.

Für unser Team suchen wir ab sofort einen Data Analyst Valuation (m/w/d) in Berlin, Hamburg oder Frankfurt am Main.

IMMOBILIEN – WIR MACHEN DAS

CBRE ist – in Bezug auf den Umsatz im Geschäftsjahr 2024 – der größte globale Immobiliendienstleister. Mit mehr als 140.000 Mitarbeitern in über 100 Ländern steht CBRE Investoren und Immobiliennutzern als Partner für alle Immobilienbelange weltweit zur Seite. Wir bieten unseren Kunden ein breites Spektrum an integrierten Leistungen aus einer Hand – über den gesamten Lebenszyklus einer Immobilie hinweg.

DAS MACHEN SIE BEI UNS


(Weiter-)Entwicklung und Verwaltung zentraler Business Intelligence (BI) Produkte für den Geschäftsbereich Valuation Advisory Services
Bearbeitung der hoch priorisierten neuen Anwendungsfälle aus dem Anforderungskatalog der Bewertungsplattform mithilfe von Datenbankabfragen und BI Tools, in enger Abstimmung mit dem Data Engineering Team
Migration bestehender automatisierter Reports und Dashboards von der deutschen Legacy-Plattform (PostgreSQL) in die neue CBRE Continental Europe Data Platform (Snowflake)
Überprüfung und gegebenenfalls Neuentwicklung existierender Datenmanagement-Prozesse sowie Optimierung der Dateninfrastruktur
Dokumentation bestehender und zukünftiger datenbezogener Anwendungsfälle, insbesondere hinsichtlich der automatischen Befüllung der Kalkulationsmodelle
Erstellung eines Datenkatalogs inklusive Data Lineage und Business Glossary
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Continental Europe Data Teams zur Anpassung regionaler Tools an den lokalen Kontext
Selbstständige und proaktive Weiterbildung sowie Recherche zu relevanten Themen der Immobilienbewertung unter Nutzung interner und externer Ressourcen


DAS HABEN SIE ZU BIETEN


Erfolgreicher Bachelor-Abschluss in Immobilienwirtschaft, Betriebswirtschaft, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder vergleichbaren Studiengängen
Fachkenntnisse und/oder Praxiserfahrung in der Immobilienwirtschaft oder Finanzbranche mit Fokus auf agiles IT Project Management
Idealerweise erste praktische Erfahrungen im Kontext von Dokumentenmanagement und KI
Grundkenntnisse in der Nutzung von Projektmanagement Tools (z.B. Smartsheet, Monday, MS Project, Jira, Azure DevOps) sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office365 (Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, OneNote)
Hervorragende schriftliche und verbale Kommunikationsfähigkeit auf Deutsch und Englisch; sehr gute organisatorische und analytische Fähigkeiten; effiziente und verlässliche Arbeitsweise; gute Präsentationsfähigkeit


DAS BIETEN WIR IHNEN


Wir machen flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten möglich: Egal ob im Büro, zu Hause, unterwegs oder während einer Workation
Werden Sie Teil des einzigartigen CBRE-Spirits und profitieren Sie von schnellen Entscheidungswegen und Duz-Kultur
Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum ÖPNV
Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe
Erfolge zusammen feiern! Dafür gibt es Gelegenheit bei regelmäßigen Team-Events
Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m


MACHEN SIE MIT?

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com

Title: Data Analyst - EU Marketing
Description:
About the team:

We are on a mission to build the ultimate go-to-market engine. To help us to achieve our mission, we are seeking a Data Analyst to strengthen the Global Analytics Team and support SumUp's strategic Marketing initiatives. This role partners with Marketing leadership to identify business needs, then construct data models, generate reports and dashboards, offer advanced analysis and actionable insights to drive improvement in our online channels. You will make a significant contribution to the business by being a valued business partner, a member of an experienced data team and by actively participating in the development of the analytics chapter.

What you'll do:


Create efficient data models that track Online Marketing funnel performance and KPIs, from ad spend to product activation.
Use data to drive analysis and actionable recommendations to shape Marketing program design, operations, and strategy
Partner with Marketing leadership and Strategic Finance to set performance targets, define KPIs, create scalable reporting and forecasts, and provide insight to drivers of pacing against goals
Collaborate closely with Senior Leadership to develop and evaluate Marketing strategies based on data-aware insights and qualitative analysis
Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Marketing teams as well as SumUp Leadership
Drive strategic data OKRs aligned with SumUp's business goals, such as ICP analysis and readout
Partner with Analytics Engineers to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and accessible for analytics


You’ll be great for this role if you have:


A good understanding of marketing data flows, processes and industry level analytical practices (attribution models, cohorts)
Experienced in an analytical role at a high-growth tech company, including at least 1 year of hands-on experience with data analytics, data model design, dbt, and collaborative development using Git
Hands-on experience in developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau
The ability to analyze Online Marketing and GTM needs and turn them into KPIs, insights, data models, and dashboards
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to identify trends and key insights from unclear data.
Excellent communication skills and a strategic mindset to effectively collaborate with leadership
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to apply quantitative analysis and logical reasoning to inform and influence business decisions


Why you should join SumUp:

🌍 Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

🌈 Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

📚 A dedicated annual L&D budget of €2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education.

🚀 Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp’s future success

💶 A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

🔄 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp.

🔗 Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

🚵🏾‍♂️ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We’re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: AI Data Analyst (m/w/d) – Daten, Automatisierung & KI-Innovation
Description:
Das Unternehmen




Unser Kunde, ein dynamisches, profitables Unternehmen im E-Commerce sucht aktuell einen AI Analyst (m/w/d), der datengetriebene Prozesse optimiert und Automatisierungslösungen entwickelt.

Das Unternehmen hat sich als führende Plattform in seiner Nische etabliert und verbindet Technologie mit kreativen Produkten. Mit einem starken digitalen Fokus setzt es auf innovative Datenstrategien, um personalisierte Erlebnisse für seine Kunden zu schaffen. Hier bekommst du die Möglichkeit, modernste KI-Technologien in einem datengetriebenen Umfeld einzusetzen und direkt Einfluss auf das Wachstum des Unternehmens zu nehmen.




Deine Rolle

Du bist ein analytischer Kopf mit einem Gespür für datenbasierte Optimierung? In dieser Position übernimmst du die Verantwortung für die Analyse, Integration und Automatisierung von Datenprozessen, um strategische Entscheidungen zu unterstützen und operative Abläufe effizienter zu gestalten.

Deine Hauptaufgaben umfassen:

Effiziente Datenverarbeitung & Automatisierung – Entwicklung von datengetriebenen Workflows zur Optimierung unternehmensweiter Prozesse
KI-gestützte Optimierung: Einsatz moderner Technologien wie Machine Learning zur Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen
Analyse & Reporting – Erstellung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Trends und Geschäftskennzahlen
Datenverknüpfung & -modellierung – Strukturierung und Integration heterogener Datenquellen für eine konsistente und belastbare Datenbasis
Technologieeinsatz & Innovation – Identifikation neuer Tools und Methoden zur Automatisierung von Analyse- und Reportingprozessen
Zusammenarbeit mit internen Teams – Unterstützung von Fachbereichen wie Marketing, Produktentwicklung und IT durch datenbasierte Erkenntnisse




Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem oder technischem Schwerpunkt (z. B. Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit Fokus auf Analytics)
Mind. 1 Jahr berufliche Erfahrung im eCommerce
Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen aus unterschiedlichen Quellen
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie praktische Erfahrung mit Data Warehousing
Grundlegende Programmierkenntnisse (z. B. Python) zur Automatisierung von Abläufen von Vorteil
Strukturierte, analytische Denkweise mit der Fähigkeit, Daten in umsetzbare Maßnahmen zu übersetzen
Interesse an datengetriebenen Geschäftsmodellen und digitalen Märkten
Erfahrung mit Performance-Marketing, Web-Analytics ist ein Plus, aber kein Muss




Was dich erwartet

Verantwortung & Gestaltungsspielraum – Du hast direkten Einfluss auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen und kannst eigene Ideen einbringen
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell – Flexibilität zwischen Homeoffice und Büro, angepasst an deine Bedürfnisse
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten – Individuelle Entwicklung durch Schulungen, Workshops und regelmäßiges Feedback
Attraktive Zusatzleistungen – Vergünstigungen für Sportangebote, Mobilitätslösungen und exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte
Dynamische Unternehmenskultur – Ein motiviertes Team, das sich gegenseitig inspiriert und gemeinsam Erfolge feiert




Bereit, Daten in wertvolle Insights zu verwandeln? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Show more
HTML:
Das Unternehmen


Unser Kunde, ein dynamisches, profitables Unternehmen im E-Commerce sucht aktuell einen AI Analyst (m/w/d), der datengetriebene Prozesse optimiert und Automatisierungslösungen entwickelt.

Das Unternehmen hat sich als führende Plattform in seiner Nische etabliert und verbindet Technologie mit kreativen Produkten. Mit einem starken digitalen Fokus setzt es auf innovative Datenstrategien, um personalisierte Erlebnisse für seine Kunden zu schaffen. Hier bekommst du die Möglichkeit, modernste KI-Technologien in einem datengetriebenen Umfeld einzusetzen und direkt Einfluss auf das Wachstum des Unternehmens zu nehmen.


Deine Rolle

Du bist ein analytischer Kopf mit einem Gespür für datenbasierte Optimierung? In dieser Position übernimmst du die Verantwortung für die Analyse, Integration und Automatisierung von Datenprozessen, um strategische Entscheidungen zu unterstützen und operative Abläufe effizienter zu gestalten.

Deine Hauptaufgaben umfassen:

  • Effiziente Datenverarbeitung & Automatisierung – Entwicklung von datengetriebenen Workflows zur Optimierung unternehmensweiter Prozesse
  • KI-gestützte Optimierung: Einsatz moderner Technologien wie Machine Learning zur Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen
  • Analyse & Reporting – Erstellung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Trends und Geschäftskennzahlen
  • Datenverknüpfung & -modellierung – Strukturierung und Integration heterogener Datenquellen für eine konsistente und belastbare Datenbasis
  • Technologieeinsatz & Innovation – Identifikation neuer Tools und Methoden zur Automatisierung von Analyse- und Reportingprozessen
  • Zusammenarbeit mit internen Teams – Unterstützung von Fachbereichen wie Marketing, Produktentwicklung und IT durch datenbasierte Erkenntnisse


Dein Profil

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem oder technischem Schwerpunkt (z. B. Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit Fokus auf Analytics)
  • Mind. 1 Jahr berufliche Erfahrung im eCommerce
  • Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen aus unterschiedlichen Quellen
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie praktische Erfahrung mit Data Warehousing
  • Grundlegende Programmierkenntnisse (z. B. Python) zur Automatisierung von Abläufen von Vorteil
  • Strukturierte, analytische Denkweise mit der Fähigkeit, Daten in umsetzbare Maßnahmen zu übersetzen
  • Interesse an datengetriebenen Geschäftsmodellen und digitalen Märkten
  • Erfahrung mit Performance-Marketing, Web-Analytics ist ein Plus, aber kein Muss


Was dich erwartet

  • Verantwortung & Gestaltungsspielraum – Du hast direkten Einfluss auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen und kannst eigene Ideen einbringen
  • Hybrides Arbeitsmodell – Flexibilität zwischen Homeoffice und Büro, angepasst an deine Bedürfnisse
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten – Individuelle Entwicklung durch Schulungen, Workshops und regelmäßiges Feedback
  • Attraktive Zusatzleistungen – Vergünstigungen für Sportangebote, Mobilitätslösungen und exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte
  • Dynamische Unternehmenskultur – Ein motiviertes Team, das sich gegenseitig inspiriert und gemeinsam Erfolge feiert


Bereit, Daten in wertvolle Insights zu verwandeln? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.




We are looking for a Data Analyst (m/f/d)

(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our location in Berlin, Verl, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Stockholm – hybrid working conditions available.




Key Responsibilities:

Explore large datasets, evaluate the data quality and model data
Apply statistical methods to understand consumer behavioral patterns relevant for product development and operational efficiency
Analyze problems to understand their root cause
Work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to build and implement analytical solutions
Collaborate on data-related projects
Visualize data and turn data into stories
Derive actionable insights, provide decision support, and make recommendations based on data-driven insights
Consult business units and functional units, such as product or commercial teams in data related questions
Drive, manage and lead data related projects while fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.




Your Profile:

Master/MBA degree in numerate subject (e.g. Data Science, Mathematics, Informatics, Economics, Natural Science or Engineering)
3+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis roles within Data & Analytics solutions
Proficient in a programming language such as SQL, Python or R
Experience in cluster analysis, machine learning
Understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation
Advanced in collecting, organizing, analysing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to identify issues, structure and conduct necessary analysis, and draw well-informed conclusions
Consulting skills, especially strong ability to provide insights and recommendations
Extraordinary communication skills to effectively convey complex information and collaborate with diverse teams
Ability to balance multiple priorities, be detail-oriented, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Excellent Team player




Nice if you have:

Experience within the payments, risk, debt collection or factoring space
Experience with modern data stacks, preferably Databricks
Experience in quantitative research

#EUR33




Thrive at Riverty with great benefits:

Immerse yourself in a welcoming, trust-filled atmosphere as part of our agile teams and explore the fantastic opportunities within the Bertelsmann Group.
Put your health first by engaging in a variety of supported sports and leisure activities – it's important to us!
Empower your growth and professional development with Riverty’s training sessions and customized development plans. Together, we'll learn, evolve, and achieve success.
Know that you're appreciated with plenty of employee benefits & discounts just for you.
Experience the best of both worlds with our flexible working arrangements, which let you mix on-site teamwork and remote work to create the perfect professional experience that suits your life.

Please note, benefits could be different depending on location or agreement details, and they may alter over time. We'd be delighted to explore these benefits in greater depth during an interview.




About Us

We are Riverty. And we believe everyone should be in control of their financials. We ask you to join in. Because together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. We build on experience of more than 50 years. More than 5,000 people in 13 countries drive our company and contribution to society. And we have their backs. We make sure they feel supported and included: Across teams, across physical and invisible borders and across the globe.

Our world is growing. And we’re here. Together, we’re finding smarter, simpler, seamlessly connected ways to manage money. By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.

And. Everything we do, starts with you. Join us and let‘s build a more sustainable financial future, together.




We keep what we promise:

More information on riverty.com/careers. Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to receiving your online application – with just a few clicks.

We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
At Entyre, our mission is to reduce both under and over-provision of healthcare through the intelligent combination of human expertise and technology. Our dedicated care consultants work tirelessly on an international level, supported by our proprietary software solutions.

We believe that individuals in need of care, who are looked after by their relatives at home, have the right to live a self-determined and dignified life in their own homes. With our brands Pflegewegweiser and Entyre Care, we are committed to achieving this goal by focusing on two central pillars: providing professional support to caregiving relatives in all areas of home care with our extensive expertise and ensuring fair monetary compensation for their efforts. We are also driving the development of innovative solutions in collaboration with scientific partners.

In this vital, dynamic, and international environment, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to join our team in Berlin.







Key Responsibilities

Develop data models with DBT on DataBricks for marketing, sales and operations
Develop optimized SQL queries to aggregate and explore data from multiple datasets, identify opportunities and limitations within our data sets and deliver reliable and high quality analysis to drive strategic insights.
Translate complex data insights into compelling narratives that drive action across marketing and leadership teams.
Enable teams with self-service analytics by maintaining curated data sources and developing automated, scalable dashboards by applying intuitive data visualization and dashboard design best practices.
Own key projects and respond to ad-hoc data requests from internal and external stakeholders. Define, calculate, and validate key performance metrics (KPIs), identifying automation opportunities and developing self-service analytics solutions.
Communicate with stakeholders on various projects to gather requirements, collect feedback and present deliverables to achieve expected outcomes.
Brainstorm creative solutions to exploratory projects built around ambiguity, including running analysis to identify problems, understand root cause of trends, provide actionable insights and recommend solutions.
Work collaboratively and cross functionally with other members of the data team to support testing/experimentation, data modeling, data visualization & data science.
Collaborate with data scientists to leverage A/B testing and incrementality analysis to measure marketing effectiveness and optimize campaign performance.




Value Proposition

Make a Life-Changing Impact: Your analyses will directly contribute to improving the lives of millions. You will play a crucial role in helping low-income families access quality homecare.
Personal Growth and Learning Opportunities: Join a vibrant, dedicated team and contribute to building the next industry-defining company. You’ll gain exposure to various aspects of the business while expanding your skills.
Energizing & Flat Hierarchy Team Culture: We care deeply about one another and are committed to collaboration and teamwork. You’ll have the autonomy to drive your initiatives and make a meaningful impact.




Hard Requirements

Minimum of 4 years of experience in growth marketing analytics, data science, preferably in direct-to-consumer and e-commerce companies.
Experience with marketing analytics, attribution modelling, customer segmentation, and predictive modelling for growth and retention.
Expertise in SQL and proficiency in either Python (or R) for advanced data analysis and automation. Experience with dbt, Looker, or other modern analytics tools is a plus.
Familiarity with B2C acquisition and subscription marketing concepts and metrics, including customer journeys, conversion funnels and critical reporting (CAC, payback, retention rate, etc.).
Hands-on experience working with structured and unstructured data in cloud-based environments, like Databricks, BigQuery etc.
Comfortable navigating large datasets, acquiring and cleansing data from multiple sources.
Demonstrates intellectual curiosity, a self-motivated approach to problem-solving, and a passion for continuous learning and improvement.
Advanced analytical skills with the ability to be a self starter and work independently.
Advanced data visualization skills
Familiarity with marketing, CRM, social and ad platforms, such as HubSpot, Google Ads, Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, TikTok and others. Experience with partnership and affiliate marketing is a plus.
Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts into business-friendly insights.
Ability to collaborate with partners to document key business needs into a clearly defined requirements document and project plan.
Proven skills in distilling complex topics into easy to understand data visualizations. Advanced Tableau data visualization skills preferred.







Soft Requirements

Passionate and Impact-Driven: You thrive in fast-paced environments and are eager to contribute to transformational change in the healthcare industry.
Strategic Thinker: You have strong strategic thinking abilities combined with a hands-on execution mindset. You understand the importance of data in driving marketing initiatives.
Detail-Oriented: Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in data analysis and reporting.
Open-Minded and Team Player: You enjoy collaborating with others and have a willingness to learn and adapt. You view challenges as opportunities for growth and innovation.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and join us in redefining homecare!

Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst – Central Reporting (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

Our goal is a solar power system on every roof, a storage unit in every house, and an e-car in every garage. How are we achieving this? Enpal makes solar easy: we rent out solar power systems, electricity storage and wallboxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a low-cost green electricity tariff, and intelligently networked into an integrated overall solution.

We are just at the beginning of our journey to becoming Europe's largest energy company. That's why we're looking for talented people to accompany us on this journey, leave their footprint and celebrate successes together with us. At Enpal, you will find a dynamic working environment as well as the space to develop yourself personally and professionally and to use your strengths effectively.

As the first green unicorn in Germany and the fastest-growing energy company in Europe (FT1000 Ranking 2022 by Financial Times & Statista), we continue to advance our mission of green energy for everyone. Be part of this success story and change the world with us!

Job Description


Strategic Partnership: Collaborate with the VP of Financial BI, VP of FP&A, and C-Suite leadership to align business intelligence strategies with financial goals. Work cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and Finance to deliver data-driven insights that support business growth and operational efficiency.
Project Ownership: Manage the intake and prioritization of data projects, ensuring clear goals, scope, and expected impact. Work with stakeholders to refine requirements, prioritize initiatives, and drive execution in alignment with business objectives.
End-to-End Data Solutions: Own the full lifecycle of data solutions, from scoping and MVP development to data modeling, implementation, and validation. Work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business leaders to ensure solutions are scalable and fit-for-purpose.
Data Visualization & Dashboarding: Develop effective, actionable dashboards and data products that translate complex data into clear, intuitive insights. Apply best practices in data visualization to communicate key information effectively across all levels, from operational teams to executive leadership.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Conduct ad-hoc analyses and exploratory data work to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Provide proactive recommendations that drive business performance and ensure ongoing monitoring of key metrics.
Enhancing Data Culture: Elevate analytical standards and best practices within the organization. Share knowledge, refine methodologies, and stay up to date with the latest BI, data visualization, and analytics trends.



Qualifications


5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, with a strong understanding of customer acquisition, finance, and business performance drivers.
Technical expertise in SQL, ETL processes, and BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit, and Tableau.
Strong data visualization and dashboarding skills, with the ability to create clear, intuitive, and actionable insights from complex datasets.
Experience with Python or R for data analysis is a plus, particularly in advanced forecasting methods (e.g., econometrics, time series analysis).
Proven problem-solving skills, with experience in automating reporting workflows and leveraging data to improve decision-making.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage business, analytics, and engineering teams to drive impactful solutions.
Ability to present data products and insights effectively to stakeholders at all management levels



Additional Information

At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Our goal is a solar power system on every roof, a storage unit in every house, and an e-car in every garage. How are we achieving this? Enpal makes solar easy: we rent out solar power systems, electricity storage and wallboxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a low-cost green electricity tariff, and intelligently networked into an integrated overall solution.

We are just at the beginning of our journey to becoming Europe's largest energy company. That's why we're looking for talented people to accompany us on this journey, leave their footprint and celebrate successes together with us. At Enpal, you will find a dynamic working environment as well as the space to develop yourself personally and professionally and to use your strengths effectively.

As the first green unicorn in Germany and the fastest-growing energy company in Europe (FT1000 Ranking 2022 by Financial Times & Statista), we continue to advance our mission of green energy for everyone. Be part of this success story and change the world with us!

Job Description

  • Strategic Partnership: Collaborate with the VP of Financial BI, VP of FP&A, and C-Suite leadership to align business intelligence strategies with financial goals. Work cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and Finance to deliver data-driven insights that support business growth and operational efficiency.
  • Project Ownership: Manage the intake and prioritization of data projects, ensuring clear goals, scope, and expected impact. Work with stakeholders to refine requirements, prioritize initiatives, and drive execution in alignment with business objectives.
  • End-to-End Data Solutions: Own the full lifecycle of data solutions, from scoping and MVP development to data modeling, implementation, and validation. Work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business leaders to ensure solutions are scalable and fit-for-purpose.
  • Data Visualization & Dashboarding: Develop effective, actionable dashboards and data products that translate complex data into clear, intuitive insights. Apply best practices in data visualization to communicate key information effectively across all levels, from operational teams to executive leadership.
  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Conduct ad-hoc analyses and exploratory data work to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Provide proactive recommendations that drive business performance and ensure ongoing monitoring of key metrics.
  • Enhancing Data Culture: Elevate analytical standards and best practices within the organization. Share knowledge, refine methodologies, and stay up to date with the latest BI, data visualization, and analytics trends.


Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, with a strong understanding of customer acquisition, finance, and business performance drivers.
  • Technical expertise in SQL, ETL processes, and BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit, and Tableau.
  • Strong data visualization and dashboarding skills, with the ability to create clear, intuitive, and actionable insights from complex datasets.
  • Experience with Python or R for data analysis is a plus, particularly in advanced forecasting methods (e.g., econometrics, time series analysis).
  • Proven problem-solving skills, with experience in automating reporting workflows and leveraging data to improve decision-making.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage business, analytics, and engineering teams to drive impactful solutions.
  • Ability to present data products and insights effectively to stakeholders at all management levels


Additional Information

At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We’re proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 – but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide




Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon







Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

Show more

Title: Salesforce Developer
Description:
Salesforce Developer – Commerce Focus

Berlin

Hybrid (3 days onsite)







Are you an experienced Salesforce Developer with a passion for e-commerce and expertise in Salesforce Order Management System (OMS)? Join a leading force in the gaming and tech industry, where we create cutting-edge online shopping experiences.




The Role

As a Salesforce Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimizing Salesforce Commerce Cloud and OMS solutions. Your work will directly impact online store performance, order management processes, and customer experience.




What You’ll Be Doing

Salesforce Commerce Cloud Development – Build and maintain scalable e-commerce solutions.
OMS Optimization – Streamline order processing, fulfillment, inventory, and returns.
Customization & Integration – Develop APIs and integrate third-party systems (payment gateways, shipping providers).
Performance Tuning – Enhance system efficiency for seamless customer journeys.
Collaboration – Work with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative e-commerce solutions.




What We’re Looking For

3+ years of Salesforce Development experience with a focus on Commerce & OMS.
Strong skills in Apex, Visualforce, JavaScript, and web technologies.
Knowledge of e-commerce best practices and trends.
Experience with Git, Agile methodologies, and API integrations.
Passion for gaming and tech is a plus.




Location




What’s in It for You?




Competitive salary & benefits package
Work with cutting-edge e-commerce technology
Career growth and development opportunities
A collaborative and innovative work environment




Interested? Apply now or reach out for more details.

Show more

Title: Environmental Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Berlin

Your tasks


Collecting, processing, and handling energy and water data for ESG/non-financial reporting.
Supporting the analysis and implementation of digital solutions and procedures for data collection and reporting.
Training operational teams and other departments on new processes and tools for data management.
Coordinating with multiple departments to manage incoming energy data from various sources.
Ensuring completeness and performing quality checks on incoming energy data.
Assisting in developing reports and analysis to support business decisions.
Implementing and ensuring compliance with reporting standards (e.g., CSRD, EU taxonomy).



Your profile


Master’s degree in engineering, energy, environmental sciences, or economic sciences.
Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience.
Strong analytical skills, self-driven, and highly motivated.
Proficiency in MS Excel and good knowledge of MS Office.
Experience with environmental data management tools is a plus.
Familiarity with reporting standards such as CSRD, EPRA, GRI, and CDP is beneficial.
Knowledge of real estate, including residential, commercial, and hospitality sectors.
Excellent communication skills in both English and German.



Your perspective


Interesting, varied and broad range of tasks in one of the largest real estate companies in Germany and Europe
Good working atmosphere, communication culture “on a first-name basis” and a pleasant working atmosphere in an environment with flat hierarchies
Individual training and coaching for professional and personal development in our Academy and with our in-house business coach
Professionally equipped, in-house gym with trainers and courses at the headquarters in Berlin as well as fitness and health offers through the Wellhub platform at all external locations
Comprehensive company health management and company pension scheme
Support on the way to work through a subsidy for the use of public transport and the option of leasing a bicycle through Eurorad
Modern IT equipment such as laptop and cell phone
Mobility and flexibility through the use of pool cars and company cars to carry out tasks
Flexible working hours and mobile working for an even better work-life balance
Exciting virtual range of family-friendly benefits, including vacation programs, leisure and sports activities and consulting services with our partner company Voiio
Opportunity to attend Bundesliga matches of FC Union Berlin, our favorite club
Discounts in selected hotels worldwide with up to 30% on overnight stays and special conditions on food and drinks
Employee discounts for special conditions in the areas of media, fashion, leisure, facilities and much more via a partner company
Drinks and a selection of fruit



Have we sparked your interest?

Then click on "Apply Now" below, and Maryam Al-Dolaimy looks forward to receiving your compelling application documents, including your earliest possible start date and salary expectations.

Aroundtown, Personalabteilung, Wittestraße 30, Haus F, 13509 Berlin

Title: Data Analyst with ML Experience (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie's Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Analyst to join Billie's Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie's analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable working on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional skills, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie's portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Ability to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
Strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-motivation, organizational skills, planning abilities, capacity to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previous experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.
Show more
